reviews.title: Love being a kid all over again

reviews.text: Service at the hotel was excellent. I lost so many things and they kept finding it somehow for me. Breakfast was very good and I had a birthday dinner for my daughter which was very good for a buffet. Ok so things are not cheap here but who gets to see sleeping beauty in the lobby and have Mickey, Minnie, Goofie and Pluto come say good morning to you at breakfast? By Hong Kong standards the service here was beyond imaginable! The only comment I would make is that the room service menu for kids is very weak. There are only 2 dishes and if your kid does not eat beef or pork you don't have anything else to feed her with. Hopefully they will fix this.
reviews.title: Smiles all the way

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel mid October for 3 nights. It was a special occasion for my family and we decided to book the Kingdom Club rooms. We were not disappointed, it was perfect. A great experience, not only in the hotel, but within the park as well. All the staff were fantastic and nothing was a problem to them. The rooms are lovely and certainly exceeded expectations. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. First class, a perfect start to our holiday. It is not cheap, especially meals with the characters, but we all thought it was worth it. Treat yourselves, you won't regret it!
reviews.title: Faultless, but expensive!

reviews.text: this is a wonderful hotel, more so if you have kids, even more so if they are into disney characters and movies. The kingdom club rooms are fabulous, worth the extra. The view from the room balcony is out of the world. Its not just about the kids getting to live their dreams, though that was the deciding factor for us. The indoor pool is great - late oct, the outdoor pool was a bit chilly for us - and the enchanted garden character bf is a delight for the little ones. The staff is efficient, though we felt that the warmth is lacking. some scope for improvement there, IMHO. The gift shop is a life saver for last minute emergencies. The shuttle buses are very convenient, and the cleanliness of the rooms and the hotel in general is top notch.
reviews.title: fantasy land

reviews.text: I went to HK disneyland last week,period of stay,16/10-19/10.We stayed in Disney Hollywood Hotel in the first night,and decided to change to Disneyland Hotel for remaining 2 nights (i just think spending USD300++ per night for hollywood hotel 3 star room is not worth it) add another USD100 per night in Disneyland and you will get the Fantasia Room with Jacuzzi and bigger room (still a bit steep tho). The staff was very warm and helpful (except the front staff at disneyland hotel during check-in,maybe she had a bad day,but seriously a smile won't hurt). Room is spacious,love the jacuzzi,but things to note.

reviews.title: Family Holiday

reviews.text: We stayed here with our excited 5 yo in Sept-12 for 2 nights. We had a late checkin - 10pm - so was very quick service. We paid extra for an ocean view - trees are too big, so wouldn't bother next time. We didn't have a balcony, so our room was that much bigger. Two double beds & a double couch & coffee table. Loads of space. Beds felt TINY, big people would struggle. Breakfast in the Enchanted Garden with Mickey etc was THE BEST THING EVER. Well worth the AUD$100. Such a huge variety on the buffet, but that's just a bonus. The characters were sensational. Greeting all the kids (big & small) at all tables. No problems to get loads of photos. Even I got a big hug was Pluto! The pool was great too. 2-3 guards on constant duty. The water slide is VERY sedate & you need to push yourself along - but meant my unadventurous son would do go on it by himself. There was a good bar near the pool - but as for bars, not much happening there. Apart from the fancy Chinese restaurant (which is too fancy for the generally simple tastes of a little kid), there was nowhere to go for an evening drink. Disneyland was walking distance - probably about 300m along a pleasant looking walkway - but we'd just come for cold Melbourne & struggled with the heat - the shuttle bus came ever 10 mins & took <5 mins. Overall a great experience.
reviews.title: Fairytale Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this amazing hotel for three nights at the end of September with my wife and two boys. What can I say, as soon as you drive inn you get a smile on your face because this is Disneyland. What an amazing hotel and the look on my two young boys and wife's face said it all.
